text: Looks like particle filtering? I don't know Dex, is it Haskell-like?

elements.text: Looks like particle filtering? I don't know Dex, is it Haskell-like?

text: Ah, Alexey Radul is on the Dex paper, he's done lots of PPL before :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Ah, Alexey Radul is on the Dex paper, he's done lots of PPL before

text: <@U6A936746> What are some of the long term research goals of Dex?

elements.text: What are some of the long term research goals of Dex?

text: It counts a number of my favorite contributors to JAX / AD as contributors, so it seems interesting.

elements.text: It counts a number of my favorite contributors to JAX / AD as contributors, so it seems interesting.

text:
As i understand it, it is an experimental project belonging to the JAX team.
(Which itself was an experimental project, but seem to be more an more not. :-D)

My impression is that it is a look at what a next generation array processing language might look like.
And to identify cool ideas that might be ported into more conventional languages/frameworks.
Like Jax, or for that matter julia.

but beyond that, idk.
